subject: Simsonn pedals
description_text:
Hi there,

I have a set of pedals and I am not able to get them working, I have
downloaded the software and have tried multiple usb cables and ports, the
ground wire from the control box is connected. The simsonn device is found
but the pedals do not do anything in either the simsonn software, windows
game controller setup or assetto corsa.

I have attached a photo of my device for reference.
Can you please advise me on what to do?

Kind regards,
Tyler Knolles

conversations.body_text:
On Sat, 23 Aug 2025, 6:46 pm Tyler Knolles, <teamknollesracing@gmail.com>
wrote:

> Hi there,
>
> I have a set of pedals and I am not able to get them working, I have
> downloaded the software and have tried multiple usb cables and ports, the
> ground wire from the control box is connected. The simsonn device is found
> but the pedals do not do anything in either the simsonn software, windows
> game controller setup or assetto corsa.
>
> I have attached a photo of my device for reference.
> Can you please advise me on what to do?
>
> Kind regards,
> Tyler Knolles
>

Hi Tyler Knolles,     Are you using the SIMSONN Manager software? If it shows “Not Supported,” please go to Settings → Update → Manual Firmware Update → pedals-firmware-plus.sfu to update. After completing the update, please make sure to recalibrate the pedals, otherwise they will not function properly in games. In addition, if SIMSONN Manager shows “Not Connected,” please download and run the VKB JoyTester tool, then send me a screenshot so I can verify. Rest assured, we will definitely assist you in resolving this issue.   https://www.simsonn.com/pages/download

Thank you for your reply.

I am using simsonn manager (lastest verion), I tried manual update to that
software and it said "this software is not an upgrade"

I will download the software you mentioned and send a screenshot later this
afternoon.

Thank you for your time.

Kind regards,
Tyler Knolles
021 123 5455

On Mon, 25 Aug 2025, 3:12 pm service@simsonn.com,
Hi Tyler Knolles,  Alright, we will wait for your updated reply.

Hi Simsonn team,

Please find attached image of VKB joytester

Kind regards,
Tyler Knolles
021 123 5455



On Mon, 25 Aug 2025, 3:54 pm service@simsonn.com,

Hi there,

I am just following up to confirm you received the image of VKB joytester?

Kind regards,
Tyler Knolles
021 123 5455

On Mon, 25 Aug 2025, 6:19 pm Tyler Knolles, <teamknollesracing@gmail.com>
wrote:

> Hi Simsonn team,
>
> Please find attached image of VKB joytester
>
> Kind regards,
> Tyler Knolles
> 021 123 5455
>
>
>
> On Mon, 25 Aug 2025, 3:54 pm service@simsonn.com,

Hi Tyler Knolles,  Your current version of the main control can only be calibrated using FreeJoy 1.7.0 or SimConfigPedals V3.5. It does not support upgrading to the SIMSONN Manager 2.1.0 software.       https://cdn.simsonn.vip/download/SimPedalsConfig_V3.5.zip     ​If the issue still cannot be resolved, it may be necessary to use the FreeJoy recovery file to restore the main control settings.

I had previously tried pedal config 3.5 with no success, can you run me
through the freejoy recovery file process?

Kind regards,
Tyler Knolles
021 123 5455

On Tue, 26 Aug 2025, 3:07 pm service@simsonn.com,
Hi Tyler Knolles,  I have provided the FreeJoy recovery procedure. Please download FreeJoy 1.7.0 online (note: not 1.7.1), and then try to perform the recovery and calibration.

The freejoy recovery worked! I just wanted to say a huge thank you for
helping me out, I really appreciate the support. In return, I’d love to
offer a sponsorship opportunity with you.

I am a competitive drifter in the D1NZ,  New Zealand's premier drifting
series. I use my simulator as an important tool for practice, and I
regularly get asked by other drivers and enthusiasts for advice on sim gear
and upgrades. It would be awesome to represent your brand by promoting your
products and service directly to that community.

I’m not phased on the value of the gear,  even something small would allow
me to showcase and recommend your products in an authentic way. In return,
I’d be more than happy to promote your brand through my drifting journey,
social media and word of mouth in the sim and motorsport communities.

Let me know what you think, I’d love to work with you and help get your
brand out there even more.

I have also attached my sponsorship proposal.

Instagram: racing_breed
Facebook: Tyler Knolles

Kind regards,
Tyler Knolles
021 123 5455

On Tue, 26 Aug 2025, 3:22 pm service@simsonn.com,

Hi Tyler,  Thank you again for reaching out—I'm thrilled to hear that the FreeJoy recovery worked and that our support has been valuable to you.  Your passion for sim racing and active involvement in D1NZ make you an outstanding candidate for collaboration. We’re especially excited by your offer to authentically promote our products within the motorsport and sim-racing communities.  We’d love to explore this further and thought you might be interested in considering our Brand Ambassador Program. Through this program, you can share product recommendations via your social platforms, website, or content. When someone makes a purchase through your referral link, you’ll earn commissions—starting at 6% and increasing based on your performance, with potential earnings up to 15%. There are also special rewards as you hit sales milestones, like gift cards and early access to new gear.  https://www.simsonn.com/pages/affiliate-program     Would you be interested in exploring this path? It would give you the flexibility to promote products in a way that complements your content and motorsport journey—with tangible benefits based on your impact.  Looking forward to hearing from you!  Best regards, Simsonn

Hi there,

Thanks heaps for getting back to me and for considering me for the Brand
Ambassador Program! I think the affiliate side could definitely work well
with what I do, as I get a lot of people asking me about sim gear and what
I recommend.

At the same time, I was wondering if there’s room for a bit of a hybrid
setup? Having some direct support with sim gear would let me actually use
and showcase your products in my training and content. I think that would
add more value than links alone, since people could see the gear in action
and how it performs.

Happy to chat about how we could make something like that work in a way
that benefits both of us.

Kimd regards,
Tyler Knolles
021 123 5455

On Wed, 27 Aug 2025, 9:56 pm service@simsonn.com,
Hello, you can try this out first. If your efforts prove effective for us (we'll track the performance of orders made through your affiliate link), we'll send you more devices.

I’ll put some time into creating content around the pedals and see how I
can get the most out of this. Over the next couple of days, I’ll think
about how to structure it all and will likely come back to you with a few
questions or a bit of a plan.

Appreciate the opportunity and looking forward to getting started.

Kind regards,
Tyler Knolles
021 123 5455

On Thu, 28 Aug 2025, 5:43 pm service@simsonn.com,
Great, we look forward to your outstanding work. If there's anything we can assist with, please don't hesitate to reach out!

Thank you and I will do.

Kind regards,
Tyler Knolles
021 123 5455


On Thu, 28 Aug 2025, 6:27 pm service@simsonn.com,
